reference.title: javaStaticField
reference.shortdesc: The <javaStaticField> element declares within the FieldModifiersopt that the fields introduced by the declaration are static fields.

section.title: Description
section.p: This element declares that a single field is associated with the class instead of a separate field for each object instantiated from the class. When no static modifier is present, the fields introduced by the declaration are instance fields. A field that is not declared static (sometimes called a non-static field) is called an instance variable. Possible alternative definitions of the FieldModifier declaration are the <javaFinalField>, <javaTransientField>, and <javaVolatileField> elements.
